title: Who sang the song 'Late December Back in 63'? - Quora

response.answer_text: The song December, 1963 (Oh, What A Night) was recorded by The 4 Seasons. The song was originally set in 1933, with the title "December 5th, 1933," and celebrated the repeal of Prohibition. The song was written by the original 4 Seasons keyboardist Bob Gaudio and his future wife Judy Parker. The lyrics were changed at the urging of Frankie Valli and lyricist Parker to re-position the song as a nostalgic remembrance of a young man's first affair with a woman, and, more specifically, Gaudio's courtship with his wife, Judy Parker.

‘December, 63 (Oh What A Night)’ was performed by The Four Seasons. It was written by band member (keyboards) Bob Gaudio & his wife Judy Parker in 1974 and appeared on the Four Seasons Warner/Curb album “Who Loves You” in December 1975. Interestingly, the lead singer is drummer Gerry Polci, with background vocals by Frankie Valli (bridge) and Don Ciccone (falsetto section). The song reached #1 on the UK Singles chart in February 1976 and #1 on Billboard in March 1976. Billboard ranked it the #4 song of 1976. It was remixed and re-released in 1988 & again in 1993 by Dutch DJ and Producer Ben Liebrand. The 1993 re-release spent 27 weeks on Billboards Hot 100 and peaked at #14. It was their final song as a group, as Valli left the band to pursue a solo career in 1976.
